metadata.Title: CVE-2019-6291 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - negligible.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in the function expr6 in eval.c in Netwide Assembler (NASM) through 2.14.02. There is a stack exhaustion problem caused by the expr6 function making recursive calls to itself in certain scenarios involving lots of '!' or '+' or '-' characters. Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial-of-service via a crafted asm file.

criterions.comment: nasm package in impish is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2019-04-25').
